message:
I encountered something weird today. I opened Pintrest and I wasn't logged in. The browser prompt me to login with my account "Sign in with your account saved with Google Chrome". It isn't pintrest ... This isn't some DOM element with an overlay .. It's the browser. Like the native alert box! I don't know what is that. I decided to check incognito; the message showed up exactly with my email.
Is that a new API? does anybody know what is this? This is purely a browser thing I have never seen before.
I am using the dev-channel specifically 55.0.2859.0 (Official Build) dev-m (64-bit)
I tried searching and found nothing. I will dig deeper into pinterest code but I don't have time for that.
Clicking on Sign in or the email just close the box ... nothing happens. This is why I think it is something new and experimental.

data.message: As far as i know chrome manages all passwords, bookmarks and history and store them in your gmail account to sync your data across all your devices(even incognito), I am not sure but that(sign in popup) started happening to me around 16 monthes ago.
Being using chrome all the time, just confirming that I never got that box before !

Yes. Chrome has a password manager (and it's separate from the usual sync stuff, and much newer, although it syncs with the rest of them), has had it for a bit but not sure in which channel because I switch between those.

It usually shows you a dialogue to confirm saving passwords though. I'm surprised you didn't see that too.

You can disable or enable from settings i think, or customise more from chrome://flags

its the new Credential Management API 
https://youtu.be/O3mBdKYMsMY
like safari keychain i see things like this all the time
